title: Bengali–Assamese script
summary: The Bengali–Assamese script[5] (or Eastern Nagari script[6]), is a modern eastern script that emerged from the Brahmic script.[7] Gaudi script is considered the ancestor of the script.[8] It is known as Bengali script among Bengali speakers,[9] as Assamese script among Assamese speakers,[10] and Eastern Nagari is used in academic discourses.[11]
